thread.title: Man in court over SA APY Lands outback nurse Gayle Woodford s death - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Man in court over SA APY Lands outback nurse Gayle Woodford s death - Yahoo7

author: Rick Goodman
title: Man in court over SA APY Lands outback nurse Gayle Woodford s death - Yahoo7
text:
Man in court over SA APY Lands outback nurse Gayle Woodford s death - Yahoo7 A man has confessed to raping and killing beloved South Australian outback nurse Gayle Woodford. Close Man charged with Gayle Woodford murder UP NEXT VIDEO Man charged with Gayle Woodford murder 
Dudley Davey, 35, pleaded guilty in Port Augusta Magistrates Court on Thursday to murdering Ms Woodford in March last year. 
Ms Woodford's body was found in a shallow roadside grave three days after she went missing in Fregon, where the mother of two worked in a community health clinic. 
"Dudley Davey ... at Fregon you murdered Gayle Woodford. How do you plead?" magistrate Simon Milazzo asked the killer. 
"Guilty," replied Davey, who appeared by video link from Yatala Labour Prison. A man has pleaded guilty to the murder of Gayle Woodford. Photo: AAP Police at Coober Pedy in the search for the missing health worker. Photo: 7 News 
The Mimili man also admitted raping the 56-year-old nurse and stealing an ambulance she used in her work in the state's remote Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Lands. 
Around the time Ms Woodford went missing, the ambulance left her home and was tracked using its GPS data. 
Police intercepted the vehicle hours later at Coober Pedy and arrested Davey inside. A man has pleaded guilty over the murder of Gayle Woodford. Photo: Facebook 
He was later charged with Ms Woodford's murder but the rape charge was not added until last month. 
Members of Ms Woodford's family attended the hearing on Thursday, including her husband Keith Woodford. 
The schoolteacher said he would speak about the tragedy in time, but not yet. 
"I won't be making a statement just yet," Mr Woodford said outside court. "I will be making a statement later on." GPS tracking, local knowledge and 'stroke of luck' helped get answers needed to give family of Gayle Woodford closure 
It can now be revealed that Davey has a history of crimes against women, including a public sex attack on a woman who was asleep in Adelaide's CBD in 2012. 
He was jailed for 20 months over that drunken assault before he was released on parole and returned to the dry zone of the APY Lands. 
He raped and killed Ms Woodford only six months after his parole conditions had lapsed. Ms Woodford and her family. Source: 7 News Close Police discover body of Gayle Woodford UP NEXT VIDEO Police discover body of Gayle Woodford 
The murder sparked a major push to improve the safety of nurses working in remote communities with an online petition securing more than 132,000 signatures. 
After Ms Woodford's death a review of the risks facing remote health workers found they should be accompanied on call-outs to clients. 
The report, by peak body CRANA plus, also recommended upgrades to alarm systems and better training. 
Davey will be arraigned in the the Supreme Court on March 20.
